tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency They have campaigns about not flushing wetwipes as they end up in rivers and we lap it up rather than asking why the wetwipes end up in the river?

Surface water, dumping all over instead of concentrated zones & lots of tyres, make this impossible to become a well managed/ organised site. Where is the cover? No wonder why the smell travelled 8 miles last night! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @DefraGovUK #killingus https://t.co/4cKVPgIQov

@ManOfKent15 @nidhug2009 @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency Wet wipes are not the source. Do they play a part, yes is, a minor one. The real source? Massive underinvestment in infrastructure.

In short water companies have paid out almost £60 billion in dividends to shareholders while filling our river full of sh*t.
@sabinashaw20 I'm exactly the same my throat feels like it's on fire what the hell is going on here?
ਵੇਚ ਦਿਓ ਵੇਚ ਦਿਓ ਜੋ ਕੁਝ ਵੀ ਹੈ। @BaltejPannu @PunjabGovtIndia @PrakashJavdekar @EnvAgency https://t.co/YzF9bzwEPi

tweets.text: Health harms every day in Newcastle under Lyme while @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland are as guilty as the perpetrators. Naively thought that the authorities would jump on something like this & put a stop to it but instead they allow children to be poisoned in their beds #stopthestink https://t.co/ZSfxyqfSVR

@poppers82 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink I've just driven down the D road and it was absolutely vile around the A34 turnoff and then noticeable until Wolstanton . Got to by Garners and it was stomach turning , reported to EA yet again .

@davemh72 @poppers82 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink It all depends on the wind direction. When it’s not in your home: the wind is carrying it away and into someone else’s home, be it 1 or 6 miles away. The toxic stench is always there. WE MUST NEVER FORGET THIS. So basically...If I sleep well  some other poor soul is not! Unite...

@EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA This is 9pm last night, I thought it's supposed to be covered every night?

https://t.co/lXzFe01d2D

@tayz_BETH @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink It looks more horrific when seen as a map. Their stance of innocence is nothing less than astounding. What does it actually take for the authorities to wake up and see the untold damage this is causing?
@DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice you have to act you are responsible.

Vegetation clearance starts from tomorrow. A very short visit this am incl: nest building Whitethroat, territorial Cetti's/Reed Warbler & Reed Bunting. Video shows how farcical this is! Still time to see sense @EnvAgency @kiergroup @Natures_Voice @Bucktonbirder  PLEASE RETWEET https://t.co/Tve0B6o4va

Reducing elevated #nitrate in #groundwater is a major challenge @EnvAgency has developed the ‘Nitrate Leaching Tool’ estimating annual losses at field & farm scale using data provided by farmers. NTL will help identify more sustainable farming practices that prevent pollution 1/3 https://t.co/zh9iyJBpAi

@tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink Starting to happen more often in kidsgrove and talke . The gas radius is spreading and that just CANNOT be normal or ok in any way no matter what they say in their statements. Even 1 mile is too far as far as I’m concerned

So tonight on his jolly jaunt the smell from #WalleysQuarrey has made it 7 miles to Kidsgrove. If this isnt nuisence level what is @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink #stopthestink https://t.co/ranvpF81Jx
